answerText: soft [10] These rules, formulated by a Polish-American physicist, allow one to predict the covalent or ionic character of a bond based on cation and anion charges and radii. They make predictions similar to hard-soft acid-base theory.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2015 | Louisiana Tech + RIT + John Hopkins A | 6 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This term can be used to describe the silver(I) ["silver one"] cation. For 10 points each: [10] Name this term used to describe Lewis acids or bases that have large atomic or ionic radii, low oxidation states and high polarizabilities.
